page.title: 13BRITISH RAIL, CREWE WORKS
page.content: Crewe works has an area of 90 acres and you can fit 100 locomotives in there at one time. 3,991 men and 138 women are employed at the works. Some workshops work 1 shift, some work two and some 3 shifts. The loco test area works three shifts because the locos sometimes go non-stop for over 24 hours. The youngest worker is 16 and the oldest is 64 years old. The longest length of service is 49 years. In the last year there were 53 accidents but none of them was serious. In Crewe works the wages range from Â£32 for a new apprentice, to over Â£20,000. The works will do any engineering, from mending electric motors to casting anchors for oil rigs.
